post_text: A fun idea from Little River Wetlands Project in Fort Wayne! What birds have you seen around your house?
shared_text:
Little River Wetlands Project
April 7 at 8:30 AM Â·

Did you know that over 200 different species of birds have been found at Eagle Marsh? With the dedication of our incredible members and volunteers we have been able to record the birds that live in and migrate through Eagle Marsh.

Birds are all around us and birding is an incredible activity to help you connect with nature, that almost everyone can do! Through the practice of birding one can become more observant to what is happening around them, especially the small details.

During this time we encourage you to get outside and explore your backyard or a close natural public space with the people you live with. To help make looking for birds a little more fun, we've created an Indiana Backyard Bird Bingo game for you and whoever you live with to enjoy! Feel free to download this page and let us know if you have any questions.

Happy birding!

post_text: Check out these creative projects McCulloch Junior High School students took on to explore Earth science!
shared_text:
McCulloch Junior High School
October 14, 2019 at 10:42 AM Â·

Students from Mrs. Chitwood's seventh-grade science classes got creative to meet curriculum standard that requires them to demonstrate their knowledge of Earth's layers by building a 3D model!

Some of the students chose to construct their models using cake, Rice Krispies, Skittles, Styrofoam spheres, and clay. Others designed with colored paper, forming a pop-up book.

Students reflected on the projects in their journals, noting they had fun as they learned what the layers are made of, how deep each layer is and how very hot the layers are.

Students worked in small groups and learned how to work together, solve problems, and communicate better.

One student said: "I love projects because I get to create and use my hands to show what I know. I can't wait for the next project."

#GiantPride #GiantOpportunity
